definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
a good wife and loving mother
to take a wife/to get married (man)
wives and concubines (of a polygamous man)/harem
man and wife fall out (idiom, from Book of Changes); marital strife

sentences.english: And Shechem spake unto his father Hamor, saying, Get me this damsel to wife.
sentences.chinese: 4示劍對他父親哈抹說，求你爲我聘這女子爲妻。

sentences.english: Jack will end by marrying Helen.
sentences.chinese: 傑克最終將娶海倫爲妻。

sentences.english: She leaned on my chest. I could smell the fragrance of her blouse.
sentences.chinese: 妻斜靠在我胸部上，我還聞得到她外套上芳香的味道。

sentences.english: What about going to the hospital and having a general check-up?
sentences.chinese: 妻醫院去全身檢查一下怎麼樣？

sentences.english: The woman he marries must be a virgin.
Jack desires her for his wife.
Now a man of the house of Levi married a Levite woman
sentences.chinese: 有一個利未家的人，娶了一個利未女子爲妻。

sentences.english: In 1612, Shah Jehan married Mumtaz Mahal.
sentences.chinese: 在1612年，沙賈漢娶了墨姆塔茲爲妻。

sentences.english: My wife and I were together 24-7 and parenting knocked us on our asses.
sentences.chinese: 而我與妻全天候守護着，育兒使我們倦極厭盡。

sentences.english: Seeing this, Manoah and his wife fell with their faces to the ground.
sentences.chinese: 瑪挪亞和他的妻看見，就俯伏於地。

sentences.english: They were as fed horses in the morning: every one neighed after his neighbour's wife.
sentences.chinese: 他們像餵飽的馬到處亂跑，各向他鄰舍的妻發嘶聲。

sentences.english: Two things doth prolong your life: a quiet heart and a loving wife.
sentences.chinese: 心情平靜妻賢淑，延年益壽多得福。

sentences.english: Wife are empty, son of space, would not meet the Styx.
sentences.chinese: 妻也空，子也空，黃泉路上不相逢。

sentences.english: Lecture: Art in Photography, Taipei Fine Arts Museum, 1989.
sentences.chinese: 人觀攝影個展，與友人夫婦，妻，臺北市立美術舘。

sentences.english: The major health problem of the caregiver was caregiver role strain.
sentences.chinese: 另案妻主要的健康問題爲照顧者角色緊張。

sentences.english: I think of how after all his sins, David still took Bathsheba as his wife.
sentences.chinese: 我想到在大衛所有的罪行後，他仍娶了拔示巴爲妻。

definition: concubine/I, your servant (deprecatory self-reference for women)
to take a wife/to get married (man)
(of a woman) to marry/to marry off a daughter/to shift (blame etc)
to remarry (of a widow)/second wife/qin and se 琴瑟[qin2 se4], two string instruments as a symbol of marital harmony
to take a wife/to marry (a woman)
wives and concubines (of a polygamous man)/harem
